analysis.Summary: A responsive, collapsible sidebar Vue component that renders navigation content via a slot, adapts its width and styling based on props and device type, and provides a dark/light theme toggle button wired to a global store.
analysis.Purpose: To serve as the application's main sidebar UI element: it can open/close, adjust for mobile/tablet breakpoints, apply theming, and notify parent components when it should be closed.

Components.name: Sidebar.vue
Components.role: Renders the sidebar container, applies dynamic classes, hosts a slot for navigation links, and contains a theme toggle control.

Components.name: useGlobalMixins
Components.role: Provides utility methods isPhone() and isTablet() for responsive behavior.

Components.name: globals (store)
Components.role: Holds application-wide state (including theme.darkmode) and actions (toggleTheme).

Functions.name: toggleSidebar
Functions.description: Emits the 'closeSidebar' event to request the parent to hide or collapse the sidebar.

Functions.name: router.beforeEach
Functions.description: Navigation guard that closes the sidebar (via emit) whenever a route change occurs on phone or tablet form factors.

Functions.name: globals.actions.toggleTheme
Functions.description: Toggles the application's dark/light theme state in the global store.

analysis.Usage: Imported into layout or parent view components. Used as <Sidebar :theme="..." :stateSidebar="..." @closeSidebar="handler">...navigation links...</Sidebar> to wrap navigation items and control open/close state.
Notes: Uses CSS scoped styles for .hidden, .visible and custom scrollbar theming.
Responsive breakpoints (tablet, mobile) are applied via dynamic class binding on the <aside> element.
Emits 'closeSidebar' both on explicit toggle and automatically before each route change on smaller devices.
The theme toggle button adapts its label visibility based on sidebar state for compact mode.
